quote: Deflector power approaching   maximum limits. Energy discharge   in... six seconds...

episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part II"

quote: Impossible...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part II"

episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part II"

episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part II"

quote: Cease fire.

quote: Shutting down warp engines.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part II"

quote: They couldn't have adapted that   quickly...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part II"

quote: The knowledge and experience of   the human Picard is part of...   us... now. It has prepared us...   for all possible courses of   action. Your resistance is   hopeless...       ... Number One.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part II"

quote: First Officer's Log, Stardate   43999.1. The Borg ship has   resumed its course toward Earth.   We are unable to pursue pending   repairs to the Enterprise.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part II"

quote: ... and as we anticipated, the   blast burned out the main   navigational deflector... we also   have damage to shields and the   reactor core.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part II"

quote: We should be back up in eight to   twelve hours, Admiral.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part II"

quote: Well, we'll miss you at the party.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part II"

quote: The Enterprise will be there, sir.   Maybe a little late. But we'll   be there.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part II"

quote: Your engagements gave us valuable   time. We've mobilized a fleet   of forty starships at Wolf 359   and that's just for starters...   the Klingons are sending   warships... Hell, we've even   thought about opening   communications with the   Romulans...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part II"

quote: You realize, Admiral, that with   the assistance of Picard, the Borg   will be prepared for your   defenses.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part II"

quote: Lieutenant... a few years ago,   I watched a freshman cadet pass   four upper classman on the last   hill of the forty kilometer run   on Danula Two... damndest thing   I ever saw... only freshman to   ever win the Academy marathon.   I made it my business to get to   know that young fellow... got to   know him very very well... I'll   tell ya, I've never known anyone   with more drive, determination   or more courage than Jean-Luc   Picard. There's no way in hell   he would assist the Borg. I   want that clear.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part II"

quote: Of course, Admiral...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part II"

quote: He is a casualty of war.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part II"

quote: Then... we have abandoned all hope   of recovering him.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part II"

quote: (reluctantly     acknowledges)   In less than twenty-four hours,   this armada's going to hit that   Borg vessel with everything we   can muster. Either they survive   or we do. As for Picard...       A great man has been lost. Your   Captain. My friend.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part II"

quote: Commander Riker... I hereby   promote you to the field   commission of Captain.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part II"

quote: The Enterprise is your ship now.   Congratulations. I wish the   circumstances were different.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part II"

quote: Good luck, Admiral.

quote: To us all.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part II"

quote: Hi.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part II"

quote: You wanted to see me?
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part II"

quote: How's the crew?
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part II"

quote: Throwing themselves into the work   to be done... the emotional impact   hasn't been fully realized yet...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part II"

quote: I guess Starfleet training kicks   in and takes over...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part II"

quote: We know the risks, tell ourselves   we're prepared for the   consequences... and yet, something   like this cuts deeper than we can   admit at first. He was our   Captain. It's like losing the   leader of a nation or the head   of a family.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part II"

quote: He was more of a father to me than   my own.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part II"

quote: When I saw him like that...   mutilated...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part II"

quote: You did what you had to do...   nobody doubts your love for him...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part II"

quote: Was there any part of him left,   Deanna?
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part II"

quote: Yes. I can still sense his   humanity
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part II"

quote: Then you must have sensed his   pain...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part II"

quote: I don't envy your abilities.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part II"

quote: I'd better check on the progress   of our repairs...       There won't be any changes... as   far as I'm concerned it's his   ship, his crew... and everything   we do, every battle we fight, it's   for him.       I'm glad you're here to help me   with this.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part II"

quote: Thank you, Captain.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part II"

quote: Counselor...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part II"

quote: ... and Mister Crusher has   suggested a chip might be designed   that will automatically retune   phasers to a random setting after   each discharge...

quote: That would be a great advantage.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part II"

quote: We should also see if we can find   some way to neutralize their   forcefields, Worf... we've got   to show them we can adapt too.       Engineering.       We're not just fighting the Borg   anymore... we're fighting the life   experience they've stolen from   Captain Picard... how the hell   do we defeat an enemy that knows   us better than we know   ourselves... ?
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part II"

quote: The Borg have neither honor nor   courage... that is our greatest   advantage.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part II"

quote: I hope it's enough.

episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part II"

episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part II"

episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part II"

quote: The warp reactor core?
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part II"

quote: Good.
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part II"

quote: Anything else, sir?
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part II"

quote: Yes. You did a good job on the   Borg ship.

quote: Yes.

quote: You also have a lot to learn,   Commander.

quote: Yessir.

quote: Lieutenant Worf, everyone at this   table shares my respect for your   service to this ship. But right   now, I need your experience at   tactical... quote: Thank you, sir...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part II"

episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part II"

episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part II"

quote: It is not just a matter of   control, Doctor. The signals are   interactive across a subspace   domain similar to that of a   Transporter beam. I would   hypothesize that these frequencies   form the basis of the Borg's   collective consciousness.

quote: Can't we block them?

quote: That is correct, sir.

quote: Cutting the link to Locutus might   be fatal to Captain Picard.

quote: We have to find a way to reach   him... we must know what he   knows...
episode: "The Best of Both Worlds, Part II"

quote: Without these interactive signals,   it would only be a matter of   microsurgery... I could do it...   but as long as those Borg implants   are functioning, there's no way   I can separate the man from the   machine.
